attributes.action: set up an account which will be open to public scrutiny into which MPs may repay any monies received by way of expenses to which they conscientiously feel, upon reflection, they are not entitled.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
The potential for exploitation that undermines the system of MPs expenses has allowed MPs to engage in what many people have interpreted as a larcenous campaign of self-enrichment.

It may well be the case that some MPs have submitted claims upon which, chastened by public outcry, they would now wish to turn back the clock. If that is the case, it is right to give them the opportunity to make suitable financial restitution to the taxpayer. Whether or not individual MPs avail themselves of this opportunity, it will not be unreasonable thereafter for electors to asssume that the consciences of all MPs are clear and that they are content to be judged at the ballot box on the basis of their record on expense claims.

rejection.details: This is a matter for direct communication with Parliament. http://www.parliament.uk
reasons: Issues for which an e-petition is not the appropriate channel
